member.name: M:CMS.Scheduler.SchedulingHelper.IsExternalTaskTooLate(CMS.Scheduler.TaskInfo,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Returns true if externally handled task did not execute for more than certain amount of times.

Date and time to resolve against, if null DateTime.Now is used

member.name: M:CMS.Scheduler.SchedulingHelper.GetFirstRunTime(CMS.Scheduler.TaskInterval,System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Returns date and time when the very first scheduling moment occurs based on the current date and time and the scheduling pattern.
member.remarks: This method is intended to handle task planning before its first execution (at the time of its creation or edition). Use whenever there is a chance the task was run already.
member.param: Date and time to resolve against, if null DateTime.Now is used

member.name: M:CMS.Scheduler.SchedulingHelper.GetNextTime(CMS.Scheduler.TaskInterval,System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime})
member.summary: Returns date and time when the next scheduling moment occurs based on the current date and time and the scheduling pattern.
member.remarks: Use to obtain correct result when a task was not run yet (at the time of its creation or edition).
member.param: Last known planned run time of task, if null taskInterval.StartTime is used
Date and time to resolve against, if null DateTime.Now is used

member.summary: Returns date and time that is less than one interval before current time provided.

Time to apply task interval on
Number of units that are supposed to be add to base time until current time is reached
Method adding interval number to a date and time in appropriate units (e.g. AddMinutes, AddHours, ...)
Method computing total number of appropriate units in a time span (e.g. TotalMinutes, TotalHours, ...)
member.exception: When base time succeeds current time

member.summary: Returns date and time that is less than one interval before or after current time provided.

Time to apply task interval on
Number of units that are supposed to be add to base time until current time is reached
Method adding interval number to a date and time in appropriate units (e.g. AddMinutes, AddHours, ...)
Method computing total number of appropriate units in a time span (e.g. TotalMinutes, TotalHours, ...)
Determines whether the time returned should precede or succeed current time

member.name: M:CMS.Scheduler.SchedulingHelper.GetPeriodDelegates(CMS.Scheduler.TaskInterval,System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Gets unit-based (minute-, hour-, day-) delegates for the unit addition and total units counting.
member.param: Date and time to resolve against
Time to apply task repetition criteria on
member.returns: PeriodUnitDelegates object with addition and total delegates defined
member.exception: When task interval's period string is not known

member.name: M:CMS.Scheduler.SchedulingHelper.MoveToNearestPeriod(System.DateTime,CMS.Scheduler.TaskInterval,System.DateTime,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves given date and time forward or backwards to the nearest period occurrence in future/past. No other aspects of interval are taken into account (e.g. BetweenStart or Days). The time between provided current time and returned time will always be equal or less than the period (in respective units).
member.param: Date and time to resolve against
Time to apply task repetition criteria on
Determines whether the time returned should precede or succeed current time

member.name: M:CMS.Scheduler.SchedulingHelper.MoveToNearestPeriodInPast(System.DateTime,CMS.Scheduler.TaskInterval,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Moves given date and time backwards to the nearest period occurrence in past. No other aspects of interval are taken into account (e.g. BetweenStart or Days). The time between provided current time and returned time will always be equal or less than the period (in respective units).
member.param: Date and time to resolve against
Time to apply task repetition criteria on

member.name: M:CMS.Scheduler.SchedulingHelper.MoveToNearestPeriodInFuture(System.DateTime,CMS.Scheduler.TaskInterval,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Moves given date and time forward to the nearest period occurrence in future. No other aspects of interval are taken into account (e.g. BetweenStart or Days). The time between provided current time and returned time will always be equal or less than the period (in respective units).
member.param: Date and time to resolve against
Time to apply task repetition criteria on

member.name: M:CMS.Scheduler.SchedulingHelper.MoveToNextTimeOfDayInFuture(System.DateTime,CMS.Scheduler.TaskInterval,System.DateTime)
member.summary: For periods directly affecting time of day (second, minute, hour), method moves given date and time forward to the nearest period based occurrence in future. For other periods, returns day time of provided date and time (as time of day will never change).
member.param: Time to apply task repetition criteria on
member.exception: When task interval's period string is not known

member.name: M:CMS.Scheduler.SchedulingHelper.IsSpecialMonthAndDayOfYearCase(CMS.Scheduler.TaskInterval)
member.summary: Tests if given task interval describes a special Year period case when specific month and day is required.

member.name: M:CMS.Scheduler.SchedulingHelper.IsSpecialDayOrWeekOfMonthCase(CMS.Scheduler.TaskInterval)
member.summary: Tests if given task interval describes a special Week period case when either the nearest specific day of month or the nearest specific day of nth week of month is supposed to be reached.

member.name: M:CMS.Scheduler.SchedulingHelper.IsSpecialDayInWeekCase(CMS.Scheduler.TaskInterval)
member.summary: Tests if given task interval describes a special Week period case when specific number of weeks is supposed to be added and then nearest (single) day of week found.

member.name: M:CMS.Scheduler.SchedulingHelper.IsWeekPeriodWithSpecificDays(CMS.Scheduler.TaskInterval)
member.summary: Tests if given task interval describes a day period started every 7th day repeated in specific days.

member.name: M:CMS.Scheduler.SchedulingHelper.IsBeforeAllowedTimeEnd(System.TimeSpan,CMS.Scheduler.TaskInterval)
member.summary: Tests if given date and time's time of day is lower than the upper allowed time threshold.

member.name: M:CMS.Scheduler.SchedulingHelper.IsWithinAllowedDayTime(System.DateTime,CMS.Scheduler.TaskInterval)
member.summary: Tests if given date and time's time of day is within time of day allowed by task interval. If there is no time of day specified in the task interval, true is returned.

member.name: M:CMS.Scheduler.TaskInfoProvider.FetchTasksToRun(System.String,System.String,CMS.Scheduler.TaskAvailabilityEnum,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Gets scheduled tasks to run, the process is expected to set the next run time for next task iteration.
member.param: Enum value representing type of tasks.
Identifier of last processed task. IDs of all fetched tasks will be higher than this one.
Indicates whether get tasks for external service. If null, both tasks for external service and all other tasks are returned.
member.returns: Dataset with information about scheduled tasks
member.remarks: Only certain small number of tasks is fetched by the method.

member.summary: Gets scheduled tasks to run, the process is expected to set the next run time for next task iteration.
